Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodwinetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have an office nearby and frequently spend the night downtown. The hotel is just the right size. Easy to check in, bar not crowded but large enough to have all the nice features - restaurant, small roof top pool and spa, nice workout room. The rooms are beautiful and in excellent condition although a bit small. Parking and breakfast are both a bit pricey but this is a beautiful, quiet hotel walking distance to so much. A longer walk (10 blocks ) to Staples and LA Live but my favorite downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Hilton Checkers”
Reviews.Author: San_Waihi
Reviews.Content: Last week was my first time stay at this downtown LA before flying back to New Zealand. Great room and service. I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 2nd stay loved it...”
Reviews.Author: RollPositive
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay for this hotel and great location,staff much more friendly. 4 days business trip, get a call 2nd day from the hotel that they needed our room for another guest that would accommodate them better. Explained we where not close to the hotel to move our things but they said not a problem they would do everything. That night we got in late got our new key and went to the top floor (12) were we had been upgraded to a a suite with 3 rooms and a fireplace! All of our things had been put away nice and neat. Great room, Thank you Hilton Checkers! Lots of places to walk to, metro (subway) 1 blk away. We counted 6 movies being filmed that weekend in the area. Staples center a short walk, LA LIve and China town and garment district. Would stay again AA++!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building and very close to Good Samaritan Hospital”
Reviews.Author: Daley61
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice within the last 3 months but have to be honest..not my favorite. Does not offer Hilton Honors manager reception in evening and only offers coffee/or tea with toast or pastry for breakfast. You can get 10.00 off anything on the breakfast menu but all is very $$$$ I have been a Diamond Member for several years and expect more for what this hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: unstoppable-2
Reviews.Content: NOT a good experience. From the time we arrived with no bell assistance unloading our car to waiting for 10 minutes for someone to staff the bar, this place didn't "work." Once the bartender arrived and was told by another waiting party that I had been waiting longer, he took my drink order but then STILL filled the other party's order first, saying it was quicker. The hotel just seem understaffed. The first room that we were given was dark and small, facing a wall. Not only that, but when we returned later, it had a terrible odor. We were moved to another room that was nicer, but later saw there were blood stains on the pillowcases. Housekeeping came quickly, and the management was appropriately apologetic. We were also offered complimentary breakfasts for our full group. This was a good gesture, but frankly, I'd never stay there again (and we are Hilton Honors members and used Points for our stay). My downtown choice, hands down: the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyoffourlovetrav
Reviews.Content: Hilton Checkers downtown, great location next to the public library. We brought our golden retreiver and they were very welcoming and helpful finding outdoor dining and parks. Valet is quick. Would have liked the bathroom to better maintained, not quite up to Hilton standards. Service was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Small Quaint Respite in Busy Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Live2traveldaworld
Reviews.Content: I love this little hotel in downtown Los Angeles. I have stayed here several times while traveling for work and always find it a bit calming and homey. The beds are really really comfortable, which makes it hard to wake up! The building is older, making the walls and floors thick enough that you do not hear the neighbors or hallway noise. They have in-room coffee and a restaurant, although I have not eaten there. Nice bathroom amenities and a strong shower. The room I had this trip (315) was large and had a nice work desk area although the view was a concrete wall. There is a strong fragrance in the hallways that sticks in my nose and makes me a bit queasy - trying to mask the odor of an older hotel perhaps. The location is close to many office buildings but not very close to Staples Center or other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not That Nice”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTommy11
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Checkers is right downtown LA. It is a smaller Hotel ,compact and well put together. The only problem is that it is and older property. I would rate it 3 and a half stars because of this. Curiously the room and the restaurant smelled like fabrize or some kinda freshener squirted all over the place. The closet in my room had a weird oder so I told the front desk and it did improve. You have to pay parking cause there is no place to park your car but valet service was good. I will say that everyone that work there was 4 star. They were friendly and gave good service in whatever job they were doing. If you are a foodie like me I would not eat at the restaurant there are too many other Great place in downtown to eat rather than in your Hotel. The rooms were nice but a little worn in places. If they did a updating of rooms this place with its level of service would be a 4 star easy. The bar had great service and the seafood cocktail is one of the best I've had at a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great..now very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times and always loved the small boutique quality of it. Lots wrong this time. Very soft beds, rooms with strong smelling air freshener, bad for allergies. Furniture chipped and need of repair. No "on demand" movies. Worst beds I have ever had in a hotel. Lots of quality lost. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller hotel, but good downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: ScottfromLV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Checker's twice now for business meetings with clients in downtown L.A. I've always found the staff to be very friendly and attentive. If you hate traffic, this location is perfect with nearly everything within a 15 minute walk for most downtown destinations. This is an older/historic building, but well maintained, since its older, the rooms are all a bit different in size and shape. On both of my stays I was alone and found the rooms and bath areas to be more than spacious. If I was with my family of 4? Probably a little cramped. Having stayed in a number of downtown hotels around the country, I found the night time noise level here to be relatively quiet, then again Downtown LA is a little less bustling at night than most other cities. The hotel/downtown area is about 30 minutes from LAX and off of the 110. The hotel does have a restaurant, but there are a number of options for a number of budgets in any direction. I did take a quick peek at the roof top pool/hot tub. Very nice views, but the pool is on the smaller side. I would imagine this would be a great location for a party of about 100 people.

Reviews.Title: “business AND pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Bethany T
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay to go college hunting in the LA area. We chose a central location to the 4 schools we were visiting and were fortunate to find this gem in LA. It was extremely convenient to the highways, not far from LAX or beaches and close to Olvera St. for yummy Mexican food. We were literally 15 miles or less from all of our schools and attractions... of course with LA traffic, leave twice the recommended amount to get anywhere. The gentlemen getting the cars are very helpful with giving directions using the less congested highways at any given time of day. It has a small rooftop pool and hot, hot tub to overlook some beautiful buildings in the area. It was quiet, clean and had a fantastic restaurant with a small but scrumptious menu for those looking for a little gourmet and creativity. Our son also enjoyed the small Gym and it has a Spa of which we did not make use. My only complaint was that the complimentary coffee didn't stay out past 9AM but they do offer a coffee maker in your room and there is a Starbucks across the street so no tragedy. The beds, sheets and pillows were, as in all Hiltons, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandjennn
Reviews.Content: Small lobby, nice though. Very nice room, rooftop pool and hottub. Downtown views amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney Hall”
Reviews.Author: Emilio43
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a "boutique" hotel in an older building. So the room was quite small and oddly configured. The bed was comfortable, but there was very little sitting room. Window opened for fresh air. The exercise room was small but adequate. The valets and front desk were polite and helpful. No problem with reservations or check-in/check-out. We had dinner with friends in the restaurant, and we all enjoyed the meal. We also had a pretty good lunch there. Other than some fun in staying in a somewhat nostalgic building and being within short walking distance to the Disney Concert Hall, thee would be little attraction in returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “"Ultimately, only the rate was really great..."”
Reviews.Author: JRLAW
Reviews.Content: I would say that I had a satisfying stay at the Hilton Checkers only because I was able to obtain a very, very good rate. Had I paid more, I would say that I would have been disappointed in the description of this hotel as "boutique." It seemed like a standard Hilton business hotel once you got inside. My room was clean and the bathroom was spacious. Furnishings were up-to-date. No problems with a/c. The front desk personnel, including the valet, were cordial and welcoming. Check-in was quick and easy. Three things were frustrating, however: 1) I'm not sure what kind of tv system the hotel uses, but there was terrible reception and images on the screen were always breaking up; 2) Valet parking was over $40/night plus tax. 3) The valet directed me to a self-park garage beneath an office building just next door to the hotel. Ample parking there and the overnight charge was $24. While the rate was low, I did not feel safe having to walk down a downtown Los Angeles street at 5:30 am and around the block to get to the entrance to the office building's parking elevators. The building seemed deserted. I saw a security guard at a desk one morning, but not the next day. I'm not sure where I'll stay the next time I have business in Downtown L.A. I had a great rate at the Hilton Checkers, but I really did not like the guest parking options. It may be back to the LAX area for me. Thanks to the nice folks at the Hilton Checkers for good service, though!

Reviews.Title: “Far below Hilton standards.”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: This is Hilton's only downtown Los Angeles hotel. It is near the very nice Sheraton and the monumental Westin Bonaventure and its prices are equivalent to theirs. But it is an old, cramped, inadequately renovated property with nothing to recommend it. I had to try three rooms before I found one without an overpowering smell. There's no executive lounge, so Diamond members get a coupon for an unimpressive breakfast in the small dining area off the lobby. Every request or suggestion was met with the weirdly proud assertion that "we don't have/do that because we are a boutique hotel". In this case "boutique" means small and old and not very nice. Stay at the Sheraton or the Westin -- or, if you prefer Hiltons, at the very nice Beverly Hilton a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and have stayed in a plethora of Hilton Hotels throughout the World. The Checkers Hilton in downtown Los Angeles was certainly convenient but I do not view this property as a great representative of the brand. Of course, I knew prior to going it was a Hilton which is trying to assimilate in an old building which likely dates back to the 1920's. This translates into the probability of smaller rooms and may I say, small may not be the world to use as it related to my particular King room. It was smaller than small. If you put the bathroom and closet together, it equaled the size of my room. In any event, the greeting process at the front entrance was none existent. Of course, it is possible the doorman was busy doing something else at the time of my arrival, but there was also no bellman available. Fortunately I was able to handle the luggage on my own and did so without a problem. The lobby is more modern and represents what one would expect in a smaller property but does not represent the nostalgia of the days it was built. Oddly, all signage on property including room numbers, have an elephant logo which is likely from a prior flag or owner which has nothing to do with Hilton. I believe I saw a similar logo on a hotel in Dubai but cannot be sure and I'm not certain what flag was on this property prior to Hilton. Upon entering the room I was surprised with just how small it was. Frankly, it was disappointing. The bathroom was large, modern and full of marble which was pleasant to the eye. My issue in my room (601) was there was a constant noise originating from shaking pipes all through the night and the toilet ran all through the night as well. Further, there was a constant issue with the cable/satellite tv of losing channels throughout my stay. Finally on what turned out to be my last morning at the hotel, the satellite was completely inoperative for a period of three hours which is when I decided to check-out and go to another hotel. Also, the bathroom had mildew on the wall and along the baseboard was filthy dirty. I did have room service which was purely average and I also tried the restaurant which offered a great salad and my entree of fish and chips was severely undercooked. I'm sure this hotel has a chance of doing well and it appears they are trying to do the best they can with what they have to work with. Unfortunately during my stay, it represented a brand of much lower standards and even though I knew it was a "boutique" style property, that actually increases my expectation level, not decreases it. I would not stay at this location again as the alternative choices are too great. One good thing about the stay, the bed was extremely comfortable, if one can get over the noise from the pipes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk, bellmen, valets... Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DCPRPRO
Reviews.Content: Recently was in LA for a meeting and stayed here with my husband and daughter. The service from the staff every where in the hotel, minus the restaurant, was wonderful. Location is OK but if you arrive on the weekend, expect downtown to be ghost town. Would recommend making alternative breakfast and meal plans, as restaurant staff are either overworked or lack an attention to details & guest service. Hotel is showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Pat F
Reviews.Content: It must be the location because the hotel and staff are not what I am accustomed to from my many stays at Hiltons. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: essie022
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here...the room was incredibly comfortable (the shower is amazing), the rooftop hot tub and lounge area is awesome, and it's in a great location within walking distance of all kinds of restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Old LA, Well done”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: Fun place to stay downtown. Great restaurant as well as a great room. Very nice rooftop pool. Modern, clean, and very convenient to everything in downtown LA. Sophisticated clientele, while still very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel. Clean rooms located in down town Los Angeles. Staff was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for LA”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: Wanting to stay a night in LA, I looked for a Hilton where I can use my points. If you are a member of Hilton Honors, you know that your points don't buy too much so you want to use points and cash if you can. The Hilton Checkers popped up as the perfect hotel both in location and points needed. They only have valet, so you have to pull up to the front door of the hotel and have the attendant park your car. This sets you back $35 a day. My wife noticed afterwards that the next entrance past the front door they had all night parking for $25. Oh well. Maybe if we were going to stay longer. We were put on the 10th floor. First of all, they keep this hotel in top notch condition. The lobby and hallways were spotless. Our room was also spotless and very well appointed. The bathroom was larger than expected. The valet told us to be sure to visit the top floor where they have the pool and jacuzzi. Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to see it until the next morning, but it was also very nice. The pool is small, but perfect for a few. It also has great views, which you can see many of the large downtown buildings, including the Bonaventure. I would definitely recommend this place for nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday get-away”
Reviews.Author: Regina B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Checkers when we attended a Kings game at Staples Center. First room was on 4th floor and small. We asked for another room on a higher floor which they accommodated with no problem. When they found out it was my birthday, when we got back after the game a fruit and cheese platter was waiting for us in our room. Location of the hotel is great, close to everything. The only complaint would be regarding their staff. We asked about the LA Art Walk and the person did not have a clue to what we were talking about and brushed us off. Also, the next day we asked for a restaurant recommendation where we could have breakfast. Again, brushed off. They could use training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: jazzlo
Reviews.Content: This is a great LA historical hotel only a few blocks off of the subway and within several excellent downtown LA restaurants. On top of friendly staff, a cozy room, complimentary upgrades, and perfect proximity.... The rooftop pool lounge feels like an exclusive retreat.

Reviews.Title: “My closet is bigger than the rooms”
Reviews.Author: empire1212
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because from their website it looked so pretty and romantic. Boy was I wrong. We were paying almost 300 a night with tax and for that price I expected something special. Our room was so tiny, it was like being in a bad comic strip. I have never seen anything like it, you could barely walk between the bed and the tv. When we complained to the front desk, they said they were fully booked so we were stuck. We were so not happy. Beside the ridiculous room, the lady who checked us in did not have the fridge in the room like I asked. Then when we had to call and remind them, housekeeping brought this beat up piece o crap with most of the pain scraped off and it wreaked of bleach or some cleaner so bad it burnt my nose and made my eyes water. My husband put it out in the hall because it was so terrible. The bathroom was a joke, a tiny sink and definitely nothing special. My other big complaint is that they had no coke machines, and had the nerve to charge 4.00 for a 10oz coke in the restaraunt and bar. Talk about price gouging. Also they charge 38.oo for parking. I dont understand what they think is so special about their hotel that they have the right to charge such high room prices and then to continue by charging for coke like it was gold. I even brought all of this to the attention of the manager the morning we checked out but what could he say to fix it? The dammage was done. I have stayed in quite a few hiltons and I have never seen something like this set up. Absolutely pitiful. Dont let the pictures on the website fool you, because I sure was. HILTON, EITHER GET THIS PLACE FIXED OR YOU WILL RUIN YOUR GOOD NAME. THIS IS A SHAME.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice - fancy and trendy! The rooms are VERY small but nice. Staff was amazing and very friendly. Roof top pool is really cool! Parking sucks - you need to park next door and walk around the corner and it's around $25-30 a day for parking. The location is perfect though! Walking distance from all the great spots in DTLA.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: aquagaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted a treat from a hard week of work. Usually, I will just Priceline it but we thought we would pay the extra $100 a night for a nice visit. I have stayed at a lot of hotels downtown. The valet didn't open our car door but was friendly. The desk greeted us like a police officer or bouncer when asking for our credit card and "picture I.D.", which was weird especially because we are two women and we were very nice to him. It could not have been less welcoming and it made us feel really bad like we had done something wrong. The rooms were really nice but kind of worn out with dust. Typical downtown hotel charges $38 for parking and $9.99 for internet. The room service breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “An Uptown Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ardmoreflyer
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hilton Checkers. The staff is super friendly. The hotel has a nice bar/lounge on the first floor. We had some tasty drinks there. We also took our drinks up to the rooftop pool/lounge area. That was one of the best features of the hotel. While the hours posted indicated that the rooftop closed at 10 p.m., the hotel kept it open all night. While we didn't swim or use the hot tub, it was nice to be able to hang out up there with drinks late into the night. Our rooms were tastefully decorated. My only complain was that there are no small refrigerators in the rooms even though there's a spot for them. I thought the shower was particularly wonderful. Great water pressure. The bathroom itself was well done. If I had to be near downtown again for any reason, I would definitely stay at the Hilton Checkers again. Also, while the parking is valet only, the valets were exceptionally nice and very quick when retrieving our car.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Checkers was great as long as the company pays!”
Reviews.Author: Flying_canadian
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Checkers was really nice, we went to the Adobe Max Conference and the accommodations were paid for by my company. The beds were so comfortable, I haven't had such a good sleep in decades. The pillows and mattresses were perfect, the heating/cooling was at my fingertips and worked. The room was quiet despite Batman being filmed right outside my bedroom window. The room service was great and so were the hotel staff. Free paper every morning and no complaints about the cleaners. The only thing I'd say they could improve on is giving free internet service. At $10/day it's too expensive and this is the day and age where it's not cool to penny pinch on this service as it's a must for every working person. The internet was iffy at best even though I paid a small fortune for it. The furnishings in my room were very current and stylish and I'm sad I didn't have time to use the rooftop pool. Thanks Hilton for a great stay, at $200/night I would never choose to spend my personal money this way but was such a treat being paid for on business. There are many excellent breakfast places on the walk to the conference centre and lots of great restaurants and pubs in the area too. I recommend the sushi place Mitaki on 6th for great/inexpensive sushi, Bottega Louie Gourmet Market for breakfast, The Wokano for happy hour and Santee St Alley for the local cultural experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: trvln_steve
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to downtown and the court buildings. The staff were friendly and accomodating. Everything in the downtown of a big city costs money and the same goes for this area. The hotel was a bit expensive and there were no freebies. I enjoyed my stay as the downtown area has changed and there were pubs and bars to visit in the early evening. Many places to eat and shop as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown”
Reviews.Author: rudolf51
Reviews.Content: Hilton Checkers is a nice and elegant hotel, located in downtown L.A.. Rooms are small but comfortable and quiet. We really enjoyed this hotel, everyone from the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool is gorgeous, as is the view of the city. The neighborhood had many nice restaurants and attraction. Starbucks is near by. Valet parking is very expensive, but there are a few cheap parkings near the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Block”
Reviews.Author: Apple M
Reviews.Content: We chose Hilton Checkers to be our wedding block. Rooms were clean and beds were very new from what we heard from our guests. We had Yolanda to help us with our wedding block. She seems very professional at first but then she was very forgetful. We told her that we needed a wheelchair accessible room for our wedding block but she forgot about it. We told her we wanted both 2 beds and 1 bed rooms for our guests. Later, one of our guests called us and said they were unable to book 2 bed bedrooms on a day. I called Yolanda and questioned her. She said that day on our block was all 1 bed bedrooms. She said if the guests want 2 beds, they could call the hotel. I told her that we donâ€™t want our guests to trouble with calling the hotel. It made us seem unorganized for not having options ready for them. We had a little argument. In the end, I told her to switch all those rooms to 2 bed bedrooms. She asked what if our guests want 1 bed bedrooms. I told her that they could call the hotel to switch it to that then. On our cut off day, our rooms werenâ€™t booked enough to get an upgrade for our wedding night. So, Yolanda gave us the upgrade anyway. We got a penthouse and it was very big and beautiful. It was prefect for doing our makeup/hair and photos before the wedding. At night, it was a little too cold. The heater wasnâ€™t working in the bedroom. The bathroomâ€™s bathtub was a little small for penthouse. In the end, our wedding block was all filled up. Yolanda told us that if we had guests who needed more rooms for our special rate, the hotel will give them the rate if there are rooms left in the hotel. One of our guests tried to get more rooms during our wedding block, but the hotel didnâ€™t give her the special rate. They told her the wedding block is full and so she canâ€™t get the special rate. We knew there were a lot of rooms in the hotel available, but they still didnâ€™t give her the rate. In conclusion, we would have still blocked rooms at the Hilton even if we know all this would have happened. It was the closest hotel to our wedding venue. Their rooms were very clean and their beds were very new. We do think they need to work on training their employees.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ElcioBR
Reviews.Content: When I decided to go downtown LA I was not so sure I made a great choice and I really think that staying in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica is much better, but it was my second time in LA and the hotel was a great experience. The Hotel is brand new as a Hilton. It has no executive lounge, but the rooms are comfortable, they have a swimming pool and gym at the roof and all the staff is amazing. The price is great but the taxi from the airport is expensive, so you should consider pay a little more to stay in a better area, but If you have to stay downtown, this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location, but it's the service that puts it over the top”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveler2_11
Reviews.Content: Wife and I were on a 2 week driving tour of California, stayed at 8 different hotels in 7 different cities/towns, from a stunning resort in Sonoma, downtown hotel on Nob Hill in San Francisco, to a wilderness lodge 60 miles into Kings Canyon National forest. Our most memorable experience, service wise, was this lovely, smaller, hotel in Los Angeles. From the moment we arrived at the door, till we were packing our bags in the trunk to leave, the hotel staff and manager were unbelievably attentive. A truly unique stay, where we were treated like the most important guests in the hotel! Hotel is lovely, rooms very small, but nicely appointed and certainly big enough for a short stay. Restaurant in the hotel was very good, ate dinner there and food was excellent. A real standout is the rooftop pool, where my wife and I retired to for a glass of wine overlooking the downtown area, hard to beat. Add everything together and the location, onsite restaurant, rooftop bar and nice quiet rooms made for a very relaxed, short stay. But again, it is the service that makes this hotel standout. The hotel manager/desk manager took great interest in making sure all our needs were taken care of, to the point of comping us our breakfast the next day. If we return to Los Angeles on another trip, will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “LA short stay”
Reviews.Author: Plantmania
Reviews.Content: I didn't fancy a 7hr wait between flights at LAX and not having been to LA before I decided to stay two nights in downtown LA. I primarly chose Hilton Checkers on other reviewers and as I wanted to be within walking distance to photograph some of dowtown buildings, in particular Walt Disney concert hall. The service started from the doorman and was never less than welcoming and helpful. My room a king bed was as seen on the website photos, clean and comfortable especially the bed. Air conditioning worked well as it was hot weather outside. Breakfast was plentiful and attendants attentive. One night I had room service for evening meal they were very good at checking for my allergy but the downside I didn't get what I ordered and I think this was because two items had very similar names. I didn't send back as it looked good and was delicious. I found both doormen to be knowledgeable of the vicinity and helpful. The swimming pool is small as is the surrounding area with limited views over the city. Taxi from LAX to hotel was US$58 but going back I ordered a town car with the doorman for US$55. The hotel is central to Walt Disney Concert Hall and opera house (4short blocks but uphill), Central Markets, Angel flight, Bradley Building (beautiful wrought iron work) and other lovely buildings in old financial district. However, many areas are run down and not near good shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations Choice”
Reviews.Author: nytravelergirl
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at for business in awhile. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being the best, I give it a 9. The staff was very helpful. I was originally given a room right by the 2nd floor elevators. I was not thrilled with this. I went down to the front desk and they quickly changed my room to a higher floor and sent someone to help me haul my luggage to the new room. The hotel restaurant and room service are very good. Room was clean and for the money being spent, it was well worth it. My only complaint was that parking is expensive, and is quite a walk from the hotel. Bottom line, If I were to visit the Downtown LA area again, I would choose the Hilton Checkers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: TheEvaluatorLondon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful art deco hotel, in excellent condition, has a boutique feel and an excellent staff, perfect location for downtown LA and a quiet area to base yourself for exploring rest of LA Roof top pool - attractive but about 1 door wide, and 3 doors long so more for posing than ploughing Only grouse A/C in the building created a noticeable background noise at bedtime Concierge got me a limo back to LAX for less than a cab - top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: RomaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and love this hotel This is a small boutique hotel and located in a safe area of Downtown Los Angeles. The staff were great, very helpful. The rooms are a good size and very plush. Resturant was great except it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: Geoggirl
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at Hilton Checkers while in town for LA Rising which was taking place at the LA Coliseum. The hotel was busy that week as the X Games were also taking place nearby. The seemed a bit short staffed - only one person doing valet, and one person doing check-in but they were very efficient. We were given a corner room on the 10th floor. A huge bonus to me was the two windows that opened - I love being able to get fresh air in a hotel room. The bathroom was huge with a nice shower and tub and overall nice amenities. Upon check-in, the woman had told us to be sure and check out the rooftop view. We grabbed some drinks at the bar and headed up - it was an awesome view of the downtown area and a wonderful place to hang out on a sunny afternoon. Lots of deck chairs and some nice comfy couches to lounge around on and it never got too busy. Every member of the staff was incredibly welcoming and helpful whether it was getting us a drink, helping with directions, getting more towels, etc. The location was great for downtown if you have a particular reason to be down there...if you are just a tourist for the weekend this might not be the best spot. I guess LA Live might be walking distance and there is more going on there...On Saturday we had a hard time finding somewhere to eat in the immediate vicinity (outside of the hotel) as most places are closed on the weekend. It was not a big issue for us since we were going to doing other things most of the day. Overall a great stay and I would definitely return if I was visiting the downtown area again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: DingoDundee
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great room & service, not an overly large room, quite cosy but big Californian King bed and good size bathroom, coffee machine in the room, bar fridge which is usable..meaning you can put your own things in it if you want, great spa and pool over looking the city, great little resturant down the bottom of hotel, food great and not over priced, clean room and very happy people willing to look after you...I booked the room on one of those last minute web sites and it included a buffet breakfast as part of the deal, despite this, the hotel had no reference of this being the case, when I pointed out that I had made the booking online and it did include the deal the guy at the service desk kindly gave me a free breakfast pass for me and my wife without an issue or argument..it wasnt a Buffet but we were able to choose plenty to eat from the Menu and there were no issues...there also was cheap parking in a car garage right next door which was a cheaper alternative to Valet but beware rates change depending on what night of the week making Valet they way to go..cheapest on weekends and the price jumps bigtime during the week....great little Hotel, if I had to stay in LA again I would stay here.... ..

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place, would do it again...BUT”
Reviews.Author: RollPositive
Reviews.Content: We checked in late Thurs, and it was fast 2 min and in the elevator to our room. Staff really nice and helpful, a few having bad weekends and not that friendly but didn't effect our trip. Hotel is nice, real nice upscale, bar, lounge, roof top pool was very nice just to hang out and take some drinks up on the roof. Some post small room? Are was very open and big, not much view but nice, bathroom nice and big also. Nice wide all ways, everything look new and redone! Lots of places to eat, drink and be merry, and lightrail 2 block away. Would stay again, but a little pet peeve, got a text my card was charge this morning for $970 when the rate was $670 for 4 days, so when I called he said that was standard in the business, which we travel every other week and its not standard to charge the card then refund3/5 days later. NEXT TIME tell your customer, then give us the option if its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Iamvonda
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here on a Friday night. This was my first stay. Good location. Disney concert hall is in walking distance, but its a little bit of an up hill walk. Also right across the way is the Los Angeles contemporary Museum of Art. Rooms were very nice. Bed was definitely Hilton quality. Only bad thing is the parking garage cannot fit large vehicles such as a Hummer. Personnel was very pleasant and friendly I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this is a Hilton property!”
Reviews.Author: mozilla_monster
Reviews.Content: I checked in with friends on a short trip to LA and we found the Hilton Checkers on the Internet. Figuring the location to be good, we booked without doing too much research. Upon reaching the hotel, we found it to be really a gem! The bell hops were really friendly, offering advise and plenty of tips to us. They also kept an eye on our cars while we sorted ourselves out (they didn't have a lot of parking, so we parked kerbside while checking in). The hotel isn't very big on size - but what is lacks in size, it more than makes up in heart. The staff were simply incredible - I'd like to call out to Effren who was just great help to us during our stay! The rooms are understandbly small - this is a downtown location after all, but it is very well kept - clean, plush and cosy - and had little touches that made it more homely. We loved the bed - one of the better ones to sleep on throughout my travels! The location is quite good - being in the center of the LA financial district, we weren't too far from much of anything. I have to say I will totally recommend this hotel to anyone who is coming for business around the financial district, and also for visitors to the general LA area. Absolutely gorgeous - it took me a while to actually accept that this is a Hilton property, and a very good one too!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: vaneegh
Reviews.Content: The Checkers in LA Downtown is not very special. The beds are good, the staff is (European) friendly, but you couldn't tell that you were in LA - could have been any other random Hilton worldwide. When staying at the Checkers, I recommed to prepare your stay. Downtown, especially in the weekend, can be a bit desolate in the evenings when you are walking around in search for a restaurant. Lots of empty streets, closed windows etc. Oh, and if you want to swim: check before if the pool is open, during my stay it was closed due to renovation. But they are also renting it out for parties - so it might be closed at other times as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique hotel...will stay again”
Reviews.Author: cptravelmaven
Reviews.Content: This was actually a combination leisure and business trip. I was made to stay at this property because my Company has an "approved" list of hotels we have to choose from now. So I didn't really want to like the hotel...but I REALLY did. It's a boutique hotel. It doesn't have a huge, grandiose entrance. In fact, if you blink you might drive right by the entrance. The lobby is adequate, bar is nice. The rooms are NOT big, but the hotel has well-designed decor and very attentive staff. Please note that if you plan to valet park it is NOT cheap. About $35/day. Rooms: The room I stayed in was NOT big. But the linens were of very good quality. Everything was clean and well dusted. Housekeeping staff were unobtrusive, but they always got everything right when they cleaned my room. A plus was that the windows to my room opened up. When you have a smaller room, it helps to be able to air it out and get good light during the day. Room service in this hotel is good. Everything I ate was very well cooked, good portions and fresh. This hotel is located downtown. I've never stayed in downtown LA before. I did a lot of walking and found everything I needed nearby - Starbucks, Walgreens drug store, Macy's, bookstores, Subway, another Starbucks (lol). You get the picture. I went up to the roof top spa. The view is great. But I never got any service at the spa onsite (I went somewhere else). The menu offerings seemed more a la carte and sparse. I'm more of a large day spa with tons of offerings type of person.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Beautiful boutique hotel! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Gio4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights. From the moment we checked in, we were treated to the very best service. About 30 minutes after we got to our room, we were called by the front desk to make sure that everything was to our liking and our needs were met. We received two more calls during our stay for the same reason. On the first night (around 11:30 p.m.), I called the front desk about having a mini-fridge put in my room the next morning. 15 minutes later, the mini-fridge arrived (free). Room service breakfast was delivered promptly and cooked to perfection every time. I've never slept better in a hotel room bed. A tip: If staying on a weeknight, crack a window during early evening. Among the sounds of the city that you may hear, listen for a beautiful saxophone in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe this is a Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: RenfieldPonsford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during the LA leg of a California road trip. The service was very curt at the check-in and our room - particularly the bathroom - was in a state of disrepair. Moldy tiles, moldy ceiling, and in bad need of fresh caulking (it should never be black). The room was also without a wine opener which we requested over the phone. After an hour waiting, I went to the front desk to see if they had been able to find one. Eventually, they did but it was clear my request had been forgotten. Also, for a hotel of this class and location, the fact that they still charging for internet in this day in age is akin to charging for Cable or Colour Television. Its 2011, not 2001 - charging for internet in a hotel where your bill exceeds $200 for a night is unforgiveable.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: texcade
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this website, I was actually afraid to stay at this hotel. But I liked it. My family and I stayed at this hotel over the July 4th holiday and we found the accommodations to be clean and pleasant. The staff was also very friendly. We wanted to stay downtown so we could be close to the train. This hotel was only 3 blocks away from the train station and so it was very easy to get to Universal Studios, Walk of Fame, etc ... Disneyland was a short 30 minute drive away. Richard at the front desk was so helpful in getting us sorted out each day. And Leon was so cheerful and friendly in handling our luggage, valeting our rental car etc.... We ate breakfast one morning in the hotel dining and the food was amazing. A little pricey, but amazing. There is also a Starbucks at the end of the block and several restaurants within walking distance if you prefer casual, cheap dining. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we had an AC outage in our apartment. Overall, great stay. Pros: * Good facilities, elevators working, pool is small but nice, etc. * LA isn't a walkable city, but if you must try, this is in a pretty good location. Close to the red line, bunker hill, etc. * Bed was comfortable. Cons: * The building was remodeled at some point, but the condition of the rooms is "good." We noticed funk in tile grout, etc. * We didn't pay for parking, but if we had, we wouldn't have liked the rates. (I recommend you look around.) Of note: request a high floor. The streets can be noisy lower in the hotel. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, clean, comfortable, noisy.”
Reviews.Author: DaveboG
Reviews.Content: Living in So Cal it was fun for my wife and I to stay in downtown LA as a bit of a "local adventure" for our anniversary. The hotel staff was superior, the hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. They put us in a corner suite on the top floor which was very considerate. HOWEVER, it was pretty noisy. I'm a light sleeper, my wife isn't and zonked out no problem. Even with ear plugs the dull rumble of ventilation systems (our hotel's? the neighboring buildings'?) was quite loud. It sounded like I was sleeping next to an old refrigerator with a rattling fan. My wife, a massage enthusiast, said she got the best massage of her life there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: cantjumpBoston
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Checkers is a very nice, comfortable downtown LA hotel. They did a great renovation job on an older building maintaining the historic character while modernizing. It is clean and well-maintained and the staff is professional, friendly and very helpful. That applied to everyone I ran into no matter their job. A nice feature is the rooftop outdoor pool/hot tub which has a great view. The bar is very comfortable; I did not use the restaurant. One of the negatives is the workout room, which is crowded and pretty limited. My room had a great view (12th flr) and was clean and comfortable but a bit small and not well laid-out. You could not see the television from the desk. The bathroom was fine. Internet was ok, a little slow at times. Prices vary in downtown LA depending on what convention is in town, but the Checkers is reasonable and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: BrianH40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night while in town for an event at the convention center. I don't think there's much going on nearby the hotel itself, but I could be wrong. We took a taxi everywhere we needed to go and it was never far. Hotel has a small bar and rooms are nice but smallish. If you want to be able to walk to places from the hotel, best to check the map before booking.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CNordenstam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic stay here and have nothing negative to say. Yes, the room is a little small, but how much time do you usually stay in your room? The view from the rooftop deck was spectacular - not too noisy or busy when we were there. The staff was very gracious and accomodating. The bed was fantastic and the room was very quiet. We went across the street to the Biltmore for a nightcap and were very glad to come back to the peace and quiet of Hilton Checkers. The staff also informed us that they do have shuttle service to the concert halls that are up Bunker Hill from the hotel - another great perk! However, I do not recommend it for a family with children as it is a more upscale establishment.

Reviews.Title: “It's a boutique hotel - don't let the Hilton name fool you”
Reviews.Author: KBGA
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfey bed, nicely decorated rooms, and relatively quiet (depending on the room you get), nice toiletries. Great downtown location. But it's a small hotel with minimal services. The rooms are very small. No shuttle service. Front desk staff were not knowledgable about much. One, pricey restaurant. Swimming pool is a "look at" pool. Good for sitting in (a lane wide and about four strokes long) but not swimming. Don't let the hotel pictures on the web fool you. Definately not the place for kids. For gold members, the perks are mimal. Don't count on any upgrades. Breakfast coupon is for continental only and the restaurant opens late; not until 8 on Sunday. This hotel will appeal to some travelers who like a small place. If you like a lot of service and amenities you will probably not be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Average.....”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler811
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here when in L.A. because she wanted to stay downtown. When we checked in we were ignored by the front desk for at least five minutes. They were not on the phone, they looked at us and just walked away. The front desk clerk was nice enough, but did not recognize me as a Hhonors member or interact in any way. The room was nice and clean. The bed though was slanted back and felt like my legs were elevated.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Petrossb
Reviews.Content: Reserved a king. Upon arrival at five pm was informed that a king was not available. No apologies, no upgrade. I asked the clerk for an explanation and the reply was a repeat that the room I reserved was not available. The room I did get had a non working desk lamp, which was promptly repaired. The non working, though advertised, wireless Internet connection, so far has not been repaired. With many choices downtown LA I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Gold status policy disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jsnyder02
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to LA for work a few times recently, and this hotel has exceeded the other downtown hotels at which I've stayed! The location is great, the public spaces in the hotel are nice, and the rooms are fantastic. The service really goes above and beyond, even checking in after I arrived to make sure everything was satisfactory. The rooftop pool & jacuzzi was awesome. The only area of disappointment is the treatment of Hilton Honors Gold status members, of which I am one. At every other Hilton family property I've stayed at, I've been given a free breakfast as is the policy. I heard from colleagues that used to be true at this property, but recently they changed the policy to just a "continental breakfast". Some continental breakfasts aren't so bad; here, the first day, I was just given 3 bread-ish items and a plate of fruit. It was good, but it seemed really cheap on Hilton's part. Then it got worse -- the 2nd day, my server told me the fruit plate wasn't included! I complained a bit, he said he would see what he could do, and magically a fruit plate did appear, but I only had 2 bread items -- was he trying to "stick it to me"? Overall, this just seems like a really cheap attitude, toward loyal customers. I'm not saying I expect lobster and caviar with my breakfast, but something that at least is satisfying would be nice and in keeping with other Hilton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, historic hotel that misses on a few key amenities”
Reviews.Author: tulanecpt1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a business trip with meetings at the LA Convention Center. THe hotel is in a good, central location for Downtown LA destinations. The valet and bell staff are very friendly and attentive as are the front desk attendants. The lobby is small with an average size bar and restaurant making up the majority of the ground floor. The restaurant serves decent, California cuisine, but is overpriced for the quality and selection of menu items. My biggest beef with the restaurant was breakfast. I received the Diamond complimentary breakfast voucher and decided to use it the first day. I have had varying experiences with complimentary HHonors breakfasts, but the norm is usually a continental buffet bar with pastries, breads, cereal, fruit, etc. At the Checkers, I was offered the choice of a basket of bread or toast. I received (for by $12-14 value) exactly 3 miniature pastries that were defrosted within the previous hour. I recommend here taking the extra HHonors points and going to Starbucks across the street. The rooms were nicely appointed, but the large flat-panel lacked high definition feeds. The picture was too grainy on that nice, expensive television to justify it being in the room. The room amenities are typical for a Hilton, bed is comfortable, and climate control worked well. I just wish they would figure out how to give away free wi-fi to all staying with them. The fitness center/ pool/ spa is a nice retreat on the balcony. It was the highlight of the hotel. A great little heated pool oasis in the middle of the city. Great views of the city. I probably would opt for the Marriott or Ritz by the Convention Center next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ohio2
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in April at the Hilton Checkers in LA. I was attending a business convention at the LA Convention Center and the hotel of choice was sold out. I tried the Hilton and was very happy with the choice. Although the Hilton is a great business hotel, it was not very convenient to the convention center. The distance was over a mile and required a taxi most of the time to go back and forth. That said; the staff was very friendly and the doorman greeted me every time I walked in. The room was nice and several of the staff went out of their way to help me with directions, restaurants and transportation. The high standard set by the hotel mostly made up for the extra distance between the conventions. All in all, I'm very happy with the stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton seems to get it right”
Reviews.Author: JungleKatPC
Reviews.Content: I have been having good luck with Hilton lately. The Hilton Checkers in Downtown LA was quite nice. The room was well appointed. With the exception of my bedside table lamp rusting away the room was clean and pretty. It was about the size you would expect out of a room in a downtown hotel. The rooftop spa was fantastic. It was a bizarrely cold day in LA, and raining. And I was the only one up there, on this gorgeous deck among sky scrapers in a bubbling hot tubâ€¦ I definitely enjoyed that! The only bad experience was from some people who were eating the Lobby. I do not believe they were guests, they were just eating dinner at the hotel. I was waiting for some friends to arrive and these guys started talking to me, and then got really rowdy and completely inappropriate. Seriously, the guy asked me if I wanted to make â€œArianâ€� children with him! Of course I got up and walked outside. The doorman saw me and immediately asked me if something was wrong, and I waved it off and said that I was just waiting for some friends and some crazy guys in the lobby were harassing me. He was so upset he was willing to have them escorted out. It was very well handled. All in all, itâ€™s a good hotel for its price. If you want LA culture, I wouldnâ€™t really suggest staying in downtown, head out to one of the beach areas or Hollywood. But if you are on business and need to stay in the center of it all, this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: boppy482
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying downtown but I'm so glad my husband talked me into staying at the Hilton! True to Hilton form, the staff was extremely courteous and gracious, the rooms were large enough and the bed was very comfortable. The rooftop pool is so nice and we even relaxed out on the outdoor patio with our cocktails. The hotel is very close to the Disney concert hall and they have driver's service. We'll definitely use that service next time we stay. Overall a wonderful couple's getaway spot, especially if you enjoy dining in downtown or going to the theatre. We will definitely stay at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are terrible and things were stolen by staff!”
Reviews.Author: susanna_l1
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my grandmother for the first time in USA and can't believe I was treated so badly during the first few days in the country, from HILTON staff! read on... Although this hotel meets all the expectations of a comfortable and luxurious room, my experience was entirely disappointing when I was traveling with my grandma and she had taken things from my purse and put it in the hotel drawer without my knowledge and she forgot them after checking out. We were in Las Vegas when I realised I was missing A LOT of items left in the Hilton drawer and when I called the hotel the next day after checking out, no one seemed to be helpful at all! Kept getting voicemails instead of talking to actual people and I felt as though there was some conspiracy of the staff. I never did recover any of my items, which included an envelope with cash (which is what I suspect tempted the thief), an external harddrive, family photos and a HUGE white folder filled with copies of important legal and visa documents amongst other things, which the hotel conveniently just told me over the phone that there was "simply nothing in the room or in lost and found." Disappointed with their lack of interest or surprise in the matter that SO many things had gone missing, I made the trek BACK to Los Angeles from NYC only to be greeted by pushy managers and unhelpful and uncaring staff, even after traveling all that way! I could not believe the insulting attitude I received from a MANAGER when I was clearly stressed as I needed important documents that were taken as an exchange student. Clearly, their staff need training in handling customer relations, and for a Hilton hotel, that is unacceptable and ruined my COMPLETE stay in LA!! Furthermore, nothing was offered as help or incentive for all the items I had stolen and I am extremely against Hilton hotels now! Will be filing a police report!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the roof top pool and hot tub and superb food”
Reviews.Author: Lisetteki
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller boutique style hotel with character. This was our second stay at this locations so that is a good sign ;0) Located in the buisness district. The staff is friendly, especially love the kitchen staff. The food was delicious. I very much enjoyed the roof top pool and hot tub, the spa is also locatedon the roof top however you cant just walk in it is by appointment only. Sometimes the roof closes for special events so check into that. rooms are charming and roomy. We enjoyed shopping, and a tour of the city. The front dest is helpful will finding hot spots and destinations. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Checkers was the perfect location for my wife and I since the hotel was our base for visiting the Norton-Simon Gallery in Pasadena as well as the Huntington Library in San Marino, the Art Deco walking tour in LA Downtown itself, as well as a Chicago Bulls game in Staples Center. The hotel is also a very short walk to the home of the Los Angeles Philharmonic and LA Live.This hotel may not be the closest to "tinseltown" tourist sites, but this is a matter of what sights one desires to see. Now for the hotel itself: a boutique hotel with "character"-- a 1927 building that has retained its period architectural "look" and "feel" not only on the exterior of the building, but in the interior as well. A pool on the rooftop gives a nice view of the high office buildings--especially in the evening. The restaurant has an interesting menu and serves quality meals in a relaxed setting. I would not consider the rooms to be large but they are CLEAN, well kept, with flat screen tv's and nice- sized bath facilities. Every staff member had a pleasant attitude, smiling face, and a desire to assist their guests. No request was too much! We would love to visit again on a return trip

Reviews.Title: “A Great Small Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: jocon111
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton Checkers and were very impressed with the room, the amenities, and most of all the friendliness of the staff. That part of LA is very quiet at night but we did not feel that it was dangerous at all. When we left the next morning the door man was very helpful with directions to the freeway. The complimentary coffee in the lobby is excellent. Wish I had taken an extra cup with me in the car!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: professor066
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Hilton Checkers, a small hotel amidst the huge ones in downtown LA (the Biltmore is across the street, the Bonaventure around the corner...make sure to see both, and be glad that you can retreat to your little gem). The service in the bar and restaurant is great, the food excellent. I left something in my room, and a person from housekeeping found it and is going to send it to me. Great personalized service in the midst of vast downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MoreTravelPlease415
Reviews.Content: i booked the romance package for a surprise to my BF. This is supposed to include sparkling wine waiting in the room upon arrival and full breakfast in-room the next morning. We were only there for one night. In addition, I called the day before to request a corner room and a late check-out (the romance package gives you the option for late check-out upon request). We arrived to a middle room with no wine. I excused myself from the BF to ask the front desk about this - I was told by the concierge that there was no record of my requests, and upon further inspection he noted that this was a Romance Package and apologized for not having the sparkling wine sent up. In addition, the concierge told me that I should have contacted him directly to coordinate the wine and package details. Isn't that why I am paying the higher rate? So that they hotel can coordinate all of this for their guests? Not happy. This was supposed to be a surprise so I didn't want to tell the BF why we were hanging out in the room rather than explore the fun neighborhood. Finally, one hour later, the sparkling wine arrived. In the morning, I had not heard anything about breakfast so I called downstairs and was told that my breakfast vouchers were down there and that the person who checked me in had forgotten to give these to me. We were getting ready to check-out so I asked if I could just have a refund for the Romance Package and just pay regular rate. I was told that the manager was not in until later that day and that someone would have to call me back. Hours later and no call, I called. I spoke with the manager who was fine with refunding me the difference (it was only $50 difference anyway). Not once did she apologize for ruining what I thought would be a romantic surprise. The price difference was not the issue. They ruined the experience. I received the difference refunded to my credit care. They pretty much leave you alone there so perhaps if you are wanting a nice hotel in the center of many bars and restaurants with minimal need, this may be the hotel for you. I strongly recommend AGAINST the Romance Package, especially if this is a surprise. I realize that mistakes happen, but there was more than one opportunity for the Hilton Checkers to correct this mistake during my interactions with them. It was as though they had no concern for their service and customer satisfaction. For that reason, I do not recommend this place. Sad about that too. It didn't help that parking was too pricy, but since it was a surprise, I didn't want to make the BF walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I am not used to calling Hilton's "boutique" hotels, but this one is. It is an older, restored property that reminds me more of a Kimpton or JDV Hotel, than a Hilton. The rooms are clean and comfortable and being an older hotel, some rooms are better than others. I've found the corner rooms overlooking the LA Central Library to be larger than other. The hotels two nicest feature are Checkers Restaurant in the hotel, which is great, and the rooftop pool. While the pool isn't big enough to really lap swim, it is very refreshing and relaxing. The hotel is popular with out of town guests coming in for USC football games and parents for USC graduation and parents weekend. I stay there primarily for business and for the theater as it is reasonably close to the LA Music Center. Staff has always been very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Late Review - Must add to acknowledge value”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I stayed while running the LA Marathon on Memorial day weekend 2009. It is the heart of downtown LA which was ideal for the start of the marathon. Checkin was easy and the front desk was helpful. The rooms are elegant, the Hilton has done a great job and improvements since the Wyndham days. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom had a great shower. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. I ordered room service for the morning they were punctual and professional. Parking was expensive at $32 for the overnight. The location is great for the sights in the dowtown area, it is also a block from the metro station which can take you to the valley, Universal Studios, Hollywood and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in LA with boutique feeling”
Reviews.Author: Pasha2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference in Los Angeles. It was much cheaper than the conference hotel and much nicer. It is a smaller and older hotel with much more character than a normal chain hotel. That was a nice surprise. Front desk staff were great. Hotel was very clean. I arrived about three hours before check-in time, and they had no problem letting me into a room without any charges. Views were pretty good - great rooftop lounge with a small (not exercise) pool; the gym is small, but there are a few treadmills, elliptical and free weights. You can't beat the location of this place - tons of restaurants, Starbucks, etc right around the corner. The area seemed safe as well. Room wasn't huge, but it was comfortable. It had a huge desk, which was great since I had a lot of work to do. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in downtown - or whole L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: asconetta
Reviews.Content: very good hotel at excellent downtown position. kitchen is not bad for a hotel restaurant. staff is really friendly and tries hard to make your stay as comfortable as possible. fantastic terrace with impressive view over downtown L.A. We like the Hilton Checkers a lot. Spacious, bright and beautiful stylish rooms with cozy beds and large working desk.

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: RoyalTAM
Reviews.Content: this hotel is situated directly in the center of Los Angeles' Downtown. the rooms are very nice, so is the bathroom. the staff is very friendly and speaks English fluently. This hotel is appropriate for families but also for business men or nowadays I might have to say business women ;-) Go there, you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 weeks (Sunday to Friday ) in the hotel because of business in the area. The staff made me and my co-workers who stayed in the hotel feel welcome. Only downside for me was the tiny gym but since I was up by 5 every morning it was not really a problem. As a gold member I got breakfast coupons which was great since the food is pricey. I had dinner at the hotel and the food was very good. The bed was comfortable and the room was large enough to work. The hotel works with a limo company that can pick you up at the airport for a reasonable rate. If one of the cars is sitting around when you need to go somewhere in the neighborhood they will take you for a tip. It beats walking up the hill and is nicer than a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel property, but service deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: JonesUSA
Reviews.Content: The hotel location and the room accomodations are good. Clean room with comfortable bed. Have stayed here many times over the years, but the service quality seemed to be average at best. Delays at check in, to check bags, and to retrieve bags. After the first night, we were told that we needed to change rooms because the "upgrade" was available only one night (even though we specifically asked about this when checking in). Very inconvenient to pack up and our new room was not available. No sincere apology. Luggage storage room was left wide open with no one monitoring. Taxis do not regularly queue up out front. After waiting ten minutes, I walked up Library Hill to get a taxi myself. Taxi driver said that taxis don't like to wait by Hilton because door man gives good fares to towncar/sedan drivers. Seating and service at breakfast on Saturday a.m. was very slow. My prior experiences at this hotel have all been good, but on this one definitely not a 4 diamond experience.

Reviews.Title: “What's in a name?”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in 1927 and named after the summer residence of Winston Churchill. It is a quite sanctuary in downtown LA with a rooftop pool with breathtaking view of the downtown area skyscrapers. The only drawback is that its guest relations/ services department is understaffed and hence long lines are expected in the remarkably tiny reception area

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but lacking”
Reviews.Author: TN Travelr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Checkers three night August 4-6. Overall the hotel is good and my stay was pleasant. As Hilton Gold I had breakfast coupons and free internet and the food was excellent and the internet met my needs regarding speed, etc. I only had two complaints. One was that I was given a room on 1st floor(actually 4th) overlooking the library(Room 104) and sidewalk on South Grand instead of a high floor as I requested. Turned out that it was quiet and the view very pleasant. The other complaint was that the room had a very nice 42 inch plasma TV with NO HD Channels. All pictures were very "fuzzy" stretched to 42 inches. Surely Hilton Checkers can afford to upgrade their TV signals to get digital and HD TV.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Checkers Los Angeles- good choice for downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Andriegel
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton honors Gold member, and I stay at the Hilton checkers Los Angeles for one week each year during the month of July. I am pleased to report that the Hilton checkers has improved in the past deficiencies associated with cleanliness and dishware. During my most recent stay during the last week of July 2010, I experience excellent service and great attitudes from every staff person I encountered. â€¢ Even though I was on the 11th floor on the library side, I still was disturbed by the sounds of the city including car alarms are four o'clock in the morning. The Hilton checkers has updated Windows, but the sound attenuation is not that great. â€¢ My room included an updated flat panel television since my last visit. It is a shame that hotels will buy flat panels for their guest rooms yet. Do not provide any HDTV channels. It is a shame to have such a large and beautiful screen only to have the crummy signal that looks the same as it did in the 70s with rabbit ears antenna. Overall, I would recommend the Hilton Checkers for a stay in downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: sacramentomom61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Checkers to attend a conference at the Omni, just a few blocks away. The hotel is smaller than your typical chain hotel, but what it lacks in size it makes up in character. Yes, only one elevator was working, but it didn't seem to be a big problem. Room 1014 is at the end of a hall with two nice double size beds, it was quiet and clean and had some character.We walked to the Ahmanson theatre in about 15 minutes with no problems, the area seemed safe even at 11pm. The spa on the roof is nice with a view of the surrounding building lights. The wi fi should be free, not $9.95/day. A hotel reception would be a nice addition or at least a complimentary pot of coffee in the lobby and water.The Omni is larger, with more sitting areas and more amenities, but the Hilton checkers has more character...

Reviews.Title: “Atypical Hilton- Quaint, Small, and charming”
Reviews.Author: trojo323
Reviews.Content: General Summary: Not really your stereotypical Hilton. Size wise this is a small indy boutique hotel with a great bar, generally friendly staff, average-sized, clean and comfortable rooms and boutiquey amenity offerings (i.e. not many). Check-in: Went smoothly and quickly, albeit it was 10pm.Elevators are a bit slow at times and for someone as impatient as myself - a considerable frustration...but it's old and retro. Room: Comfortable. Typical Hilton room, while the property itself is not your typical, the room certainly is in it's styling and character. The bathroom had only a walk-in shower(which I prefer), but with nods to an earlier time. Lots of gray and white marble; it was a good size and everything worked well. F&B: Food was typical Hilton, but quite nice. Slightly overpriced, but in line with hotel food costs. Great little bar with fantastic specials on one-day (Thursday??). Nice bar staff, great drinks, nice ambiance. Room service was fairly prompt and got everything right. Property Amenities: A little roof-top pool and seating nice area. Pool is a more oversized jacuzzi tub without the jacuzzi. Nice for sitting and enjoying the weather and if you are into short laps...well at least you have the option. Location:Great downtown location, across from Starbucks and historic Biltmore. Nice walking distance to some of downtown's hot new restaurants and bars, so generally a plus for me.Parking rates are absurd, but on par with other downtown parking/overnight rates. Areas to be improved: Invest in new elevators, you need them. Offer/Improve free wireless OR an evening reception for your guests. You have a lovely bar and are a small property, it'd would be worthwhile investment. Recommendation(?): More personality and individuality than what is offered at LA Live, and a bit less of a cluster, but LA Live probably more interesting for families and kids. This is great for young professionals and yupsters.

Reviews.Title: “unhappy experience”
Reviews.Author: maple95128
Reviews.Content: I highly suggest, do not stay in this hotel. They only have valet parking and we had to pay $38 for parking everyday. One of the reasons we choosed this hotel was it has swimming pool available but it was rented out for a wedding party when my son and me went up to the rooftop for swimming. The lobby is small just like some cheap motel and there are only two small elevators. both of them were out of service during our stay and we had to use the additional elevator on the back side. The worst thing is I figued out I was double charged and when I tried to contact the hotel finance coordinator . I was transfered from one department to another and never got a phone call back even after I left a message... I traveled a lot and I used to think the hiltons are good. Maybe the Hilton checkers Los Angeles is an exception? Do not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: We found Hilton Checkers absolutely perfect starting from the warm welcome by the reception staff and finishing with perfect facilities. And the price was great too! Rooms were great, especially the huge marble bathroom. Staff was smiling and helpful - everyone of them. The hot tube on the roof with the great view over downtown was just a cherry on top of the cake, providing the ultimate relaxation after a mad day in LA. We didn't have a car but with Pershing Square metro 5 minutes away, we could reach Hollywood Fame of Walk etc in 20 min. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “You've ruined the Hilton name”
Reviews.Author: OCtravelgirl37
Reviews.Content: The good: The room was nice, clean, modern, spacious. Good downtown location. The bad: I booked through Expedia and while perhaps the mistake lies with them, the Hilton was not helpful with the situation. Scenario: I tell them I'm checking in. They say one room is ready and one room is not ready. I saw ok and then all of sudden I only have one room. I booked two. He says he only has record of one. And then I say, well why did you tell me I have two (which was the correct number). He then just tells me that he only has record of one. So what am i supposed to do? I show him my confirmation for two. He says he can't do anything. So I decide on my own to call Expedia (maybe you could have suggested I do that, jerk). So Expedia resolves it and I go back and talk to the front desk about it and this time its a different guy but he says its all good and checks me in. Then we get the confusing did you book one room or two again. WTF? Finally a manager hears me upset and tells me shes figuring it out. Uh, thanks. The elevators are ungodly slow. I swear it took a solid 5 minutes, maybe more for an elevator to come. The rest of our one night stay was fine until I checkout and the guy says everything is fine and I can go without any charges. Then I find a charge on my AMEX and they say its probably from the minibar. Too bad we didn't take anything.... I hate you Hilton Checkers. You're ruining the Hilton family of hotels. Bitter much? Yes, but it really could have been resolved if the staff was more helpful and they didn't charge my card for something we didn't take. I've stayed at plenty of Hilton hotels and this by far was the worst in experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Choice with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay at the Hilton Checkers over a two day period. On the whole, it was a good stay. Check-in was quick, with attentive bell staff and efficient front desk staff. The room was smallish by modern hotel standards but perfectly normal for an older building and perfectly fine for a stay. There was minimal street noise from my 10th floor room. The washroom was clean with decent water pressure, though the counter top was a touch cramped. I have Hilton Honors Diamond status and did not receive my normal perks of a room upgrade or access to an Executive Lounge (they don't have one) but they offered other amenities such as a choice of a free bottle of wine or food plate and chocolate covered strawberries in my room daily. BTW, I don't normally like chocolate or strawberries but they were incredible and I'd recommend ordering them from room service as a dessert. Daily breakfast in the Checkers restaurant was quite good, though I was a little disappointed by my single room service order... though it was decent, it's not what I would expect in a 4^ hotel. The wireless internet was reasonably priced for a business hotel at $9.95 (though leisure travelers may not think so) but the signal was very slow during peak periods of morning and late evening. The hotel is ideally located for anyone in the downtown area and the entertainment district. It is a short walk to the Pershing Street Metro system and you can take buses everywhere if you don't wish to drive. I went to LA Live for a concert and a Dodgers game so it's good for entertainment options. Culinary options were limited on a Sunday but the hotel staff recommended a few places that were about 10 minutes away. However, it may not be the most ideal choice for anyone without a vehicle and not comfortable with public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Still has character and charm of an older...”
